intro: Lavatera assurgentiflora, commonly known as the showy lavatera, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the flowers bloom in clusters at the ends of the branches. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often cultivated for its ornamental value.
